meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be converted.
meanings.sent1: The inconvertibility of the ancient artifact made it impossible to sell.
meanings.sent2: The inconvertibility of the currency caused confusion among the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to convert the inconvertibility of the rock into gold, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her inconvertibility in matters of faith was as solid as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The inconvertibility of the secret code kept it safe from prying eyes.

meanings.definition: The inability to be changed or transformed.
meanings.sent1: The inconvertibility of the old building made renovation difficult.
meanings.sent2: The inconvertibility of his stubbornness frustrated his friends.
meanings.sent3: The inconvertibility of the recipe led to a disastrous cooking experiment.
meanings.sent4: His inconvertibility in his beliefs was like a shield against criticism.
meanings.sent5: The inconvertibility of the ancient curse haunted the archaeologists.
